15222112.content:
Grace hurriedly sprinted to the school. She had no idea if her friend would be safe. The minute she reached the school, she would go to the bathroom and do everything in her power to puke out her friend. There was no way she was going to abandon a good friend to such a terrible - and unusual - fate. Heroically, she managed to pass even the school bus due to a string of red lights, and it had just arrived at the school when she opened the front door.

Funny thing about doors.
The act of opening a door has been studied in numerous scientific reports, and the data suggest that opening a door has a detrimental effect on short-term memory. The second Grace opened that door, she forgot about her friend's crisis. She eventually remembered, of course, but by then it was already noon. Even the most optimistic person would have given up by then.

It turns out she was right - by then, puking would be ineffectual - but for the wrong reason. The stomach acid wasn't a problem; Michelle was immune and actually would have been able to swim in it if the desire overtook her. Puking would have been ineffective because, around nine fifteen, Michelle had taken the customary route.

Realizing that the force of gravity would be of no help trying to exit the way she came, Michelle opted to follow her friend's digestive track to its logical conclusion. As she moved, she realized that, although the smell was horrible and the fumes were making her woozy, the acids themselves weren't affecting her at all. The reasons eluded her, but she wasn't about to look a gift horse in the mouth.

As she reached her destination, the smell only got worse. Just ahead was the final chamber - her friend's anus. Bracing herself, she crawled down, and...

...wait a minute.

Michelle noticed a carving on the inside of Grace's rectum. She was no expert, but she was pretty sure most people didn't have carved recta. It was a symbol that seemed vaguely familiar. Of course - it was also on the ring! What this meant - and the implications - were beyond her scope. Suffice it to say there was more to this mystery than met the eye.

I am now going to ask three questions - questions which anyone in this situation (which is to say, no one) should have already asked.

-Who created the ring?
-Why was it left there?
-What does the symbol mean?

There are of course more questions, but, sadly, they must remain unanswered for now. The reason is that Michelle has also noticed a small slip of paper next to the symbol which answers one of those questions. Which question does it answer?

info.brief_description: A shrinking story of my own design. Read and add at your own risk.
info.description:
This has really grown much more than I expected to. But still...not at all what it could be. Some additions have more or less ignored the ground rules I set, and that's okay. I'm not as big an ass as I used to be. Sort of. Anyway...keep adding! If you make a nice addition to mine, I'm more than happy to add to yours, or at least match your addition. You'll notice here and there that clothes might change inexplicably, there might be a family member in one arc that doesn't exist in another, and that's okay for now. I might go back someday and touch things up, but not in the near future.

Time to lay down some ground rules. This is my interactive story, but it is for everyone's enjoyment. That said, I will readily make changes, additions, and deletions at my discretion, for any number of reasons. This doesn't mean I'll be running around going, "SORRY, NEEDS MORE BEWBS."

What I Like
Ass
Feet
Pussy
Vore
Girl/guy
Girl/girl
Coherent writing.

What I Dislike
Guy/guy
Guy/girl
Poor writing
Sudden inexplicable changes
Characters acting unrealistically

Now, just because I dislike something doesn't mean I will automatically take action against it. If the story eventually progresses to a point where interaction with a giant male occurs, I will allow it. Something I won't tolerate is horrid, sobering posts.

'th grl picsk you up & eats you whole THE EDN'

I will get mad. It's not a pretty picture, I DON'T LIKE DOING IT.

Another thing. PLEASE, PLEASE, PLEASE read and remember the chapters leading up to your addition, should you choose to contribute. It's a hassle for me to have to go through and double check everything to make sure Grace, or any other character, is wearing what they were two chapters ago, has the same amount of money, carrying their cell phone, and so on....it's a pain in the ass to baby-sit fictional people, and the last thing you want is for your work to be tampered with.

~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~

Grace is a somewhat popular eighth grade girl. Average height for her age, sandy blonde hair that comes down just to her shoulder blades, and a pair of beautiful green eyes. She's not chubby, but not scrawny, just right. She likes some sports, manages to get decent grades in school, and loves hanging out with her friends. She isn't actively pursuing any guys, though that isn't to say there aren't a few she wouldn't mind being held by. One morning, shortly before the school bus arrives, Grace experiences an interesting change.
